title: Blended and Flipped Learning Design for Mathematics Education Technology Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and basic proficiency in digital device usage
context.additional_context: Educational needs for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to apply mathematical problem-solving skills to practical tasks

learning_goals: Learners can self-direct the learning of mathematical concepts using digital content provided in a flipped learning environment.

Learners can form teams of 3–4 members in a blended learning environment (online collaboration tools + face-to-face workshops), select one AI-based real-world problem (e.g., local traffic optimization, energy consumption prediction), and apply linear algebra/statistics-based mathematical skills (e.g., differentiation, matrix operations, regression analysis) to develop a project report (15–20 pages) and presentation materials (10–15 minutes) proposing solutions.
Learners visualize and analyze mathematical problem-solving processes using AI-based tools.
Learners establish strategies for selecting and utilizing appropriate digital tools in a BYOD environment.
Learners achieve over 80% proficiency in summative evaluations of project-based outcomes.

resources: Digital content creation tools (e.g., GeoGebra, Desmos)
AI-powered math problem-solving tools (e.g., Wolfram Alpha)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
